title: Night Out
description: Michael and Dwight go to New York to party with Ryan, who is having lots of personal and professional problems. The rest of the office employees work late, and wind up getting locked in the business park.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What's wrong Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I got gum in my hair.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You do.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: This just stinks. Don't touch it, please don't touch it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You've got a ton of dandruff.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK, let me be.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: How'd you get gum in your hair?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I was walking in and I noticed something shinny under Stanley's car and I got under to see what it was and I messed up my hair, all for a stupid piece of tinfoil.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: But best case scenario, you thought it was a quarter.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Kill me... right now.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We have peanut butter in the kitchen.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don't feel like peanut butter. Get me an ice cream sandwich.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nope. Not for you it's for your hair, and it is 9 am.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No Dwight, not the good peanut butter. People are going to get mad.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, hey, hey. This is my hair we're talking about.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Smells good.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Taste good too.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh don't. That's disgusting.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Wow! Lot of calories.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well just don't leave it on too long. Keep massaging please. Ah yeah, that's nice.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey Michael, how was your date last night?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [sighs]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I will be honest; the dating has not been going well. Look, men are visual creatures. We crave beauty, like a piece of fine art by any number of renowned artists, or an arty photograph of Cindy Crawford nude... that, but the women I'm getting fixed up with are, egh! Not that they aren't nice, or that have great personalities, they just... They just lack a certain... Crawfordness.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I am livid, Absolutely livid.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: It's ridiculous.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yes, I'm having the Scranton branch come in on one Saturday so they can re-enter sales that they made on the phone as sales that were made by the website which they should have done in the first place, if the website had been working.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: My favorite branch. How's everybody doing?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey man, you mind if I run something by you?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Love it. Go.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, I kinda feel like what we have going for us is our customer service, and no matter how we change this up, I don't know that a website's going to be able to replace that.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I can tell you thought about this a lot, I appreciate that.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: David Wallace does too. You told him all about this at the Christmas party, right?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Did I? I don't...

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: You did. Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hmm.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Watch your back Jim. I'm just kidding.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ladies and Gentlemen, may I have your attention please. I know that a lot of you are very angry with Ryan because he is the reason we all have to come in tomorrow, however, I swear to God, If any of you hurts him in any way emotionally or taunts him or makes fun of his height or his half beard or...

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Ok thanks Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I'm here today to do some creative problem solving about Dunder Mifflin Infinity and field your questions.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Question.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Why am I being forced to come in tomorrow and pretend that a website made sales that I made?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: This is a temporary measure to increase the legitimacy of the site.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I don't like when my clients call me to help them use the website, I'm not seeing commissions on that.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I hear you Stanley, that is a great observation. Problems like that will not happen when we launch Dunder Mifflin Infinity 2 point O.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: When will that be?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: TBD. Phyllis?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Did the police solve the problem with the...

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yes, yes they did, yes they did.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yes, the social networking feature of the Dunder Mifflin Infinity website was infiltrated by sexual predators.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I don't understand why our website has to have social networking at all.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, I actually have to agree with Dwight on that one.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: It's all about creating a one stop shop consumer experience, alright? You're chatting with your friends, you're talking about the latest music, about the election; all of it is happening in our virtual paper store.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: And then an older gentleman asked you "Boxers or briefs?"

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: I don't get the big fuss here, I like the site.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: If I'd have created a website with as many problems, I'd kill myself.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Do you have a question Kelly?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Yeah I have a lot of questions. Number one, how dare you?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [slow clapping] Ryan has done a very good job, and I am not applauding sarcastically. Think about it, a month ago nobody would go on this site because we were worried about getting molested, or losing our identity, having it stolen. But now, at a time TDB, all of the problems will be in the past. Ya done good kid, ya done good.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well it has been nice seeing you again my friend.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: You too.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh Ryan, I need a girlfriend so bad. [hugs Ryan]

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Michael let me go. Let me go Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Argh. Alright. Do you know any girls in New York you might want to hook me up with? Some that might be interested in a guy like me.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Na.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Na?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Sorry man.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well you tried.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: But seriously, you should see the girls I meet at clubs in the city.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Unreal.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: They sound great.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Bye everyone. Stay real Scranton, alright. Peace.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Would you have sex with Meredith?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Do you think she'd keep it quiet?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'm gonna go to my desk.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Jim, it's not the horniness, ok it's the loneliness that...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I know.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Let's go to New York. We'll go clubbing with Ryan.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I can't.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes you can, you're single, I'm single. It'll be awesome.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'm not single.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Who you dating?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Pam.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That's still going on?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok, Dwight grab your stuff, we're going to New York to party with Ryan and to meet girls.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh yes! Count me in dudes. I am in some serious need of some bro' time. Old ball and chain's been a lot more chain than ball lately if you know what I'm saying.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I'm right here.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, singles only, singles only. Also three is unlucky. Curse of three.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Sorry Andy. Cannot take any chances on curses, not tonight. Let's go. Everybody, I will see you tomorrow, Saturday morning, probably wearing the same clothes that I am wearing right now, If you catch my drift.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: We get it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I am going to go get laid. Goodbye.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [laughs] With sex!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That's... I, I think that...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You know what? If we all stayed a couple of hours late tonight without Michael distracting us, we wouldn't have to come in at all tomorrow.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So I caught everyone before they left and I told them my idea, and they loved it. Because this is a group that respects good ideas... the one time a year they hear one.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ryan's assistant told us that he would be at this club this evening. It is called Prerogative.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Place is packed.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Fire hazard.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Packed with beautiful babies. Swingers. Classic. John Favreau, tall guy from DodgeBall.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Women look like white slaves.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, they're just hotties.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I don't know man, when you think about it, Cabo's really the third world. I don't go to a place like that to see more poverty you know. You go there to get some glamour.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: What are you doing here?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well you know, just taking you up on your offer to party, so tada.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: That is so awesome man!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: And you brought this guy!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Aww!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ryan, it's Michael and Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I know it's you guys.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I'm so psyched you're here!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Woooo!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Let's get a drink.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Let's do it!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Thanks a lot guys, Good job.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Later.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nice job everybody. Great work.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Did you not tell the security guard we were working late?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nope. I didn't, but let's go inside and I can call him right now.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You can't, I locked the office from the inside when we left.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Perfect, you guys worked together on this one. If I'm not in my bath with a glass of red wine in an hour, you're both dead.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: There is a master key and a spare key for the office. Dwight has them both. When I asked, "What if you die Dwight, how will we get into the office?" He said, "If I'm dead, you guys have been dead for weeks."

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Guys, I want you to meet a really good friend of mine, this is Troy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, nice to meet you.

quotes.speaker: Troy
quotes.text: Hey, how ya doing?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey, Dwight. You resemble a Tolkien character.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Ah, he basically is man. He's a regular banking wizard.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, no, no. Not a wizard, a hobbit.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Bottle service ya'll?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh ok, all I know is I would like some chicken fingers and a Midori Sour.

quotes.speaker: Waitress
quotes.text: We don't serve food here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh ok, then just bring me two cups, one with olives and another filled with maraschino cherries.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Do you live in a regular sized house?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yeah. He's a normal guy, he's cool.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You really don't have his phone number?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I told you, I have the number that rings here. Do you want that number?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I might have it in here.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Aw! That's great Toby.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: It's so random that I have it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Toby, you're the best.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: When I put it in I thought it would be a waste of time, but I guess it was worth it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Great, It's under here as Security Guard home. Did you not get his name? Or...

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It's ringing. Does anybody have his name? Quick.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yes, it's Eddie.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It's not, it's not Eddie, it's ah, Evan or...

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Hank, his name is Hank.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No guys his name's not Hank, it's ah, is it Edgar?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Elliot.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Elliot!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Is it Elliot? Hey ch... chief, this is Jim Halpert from um... where you work. You're the guy who sits behind the desk... you're, you're the, the Afri... African-American guy, I mean you're. Ah... Who, Who've I got here?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Dwight Schrute man. How's Schrute Farms?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Good.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: This guy owns his own beet farm.

quotes.speaker: Troy
quotes.text: Insane.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Well it's weevil season but we were prepared.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Weevils, what a crazy word man. What? I don't even know what that means. What does that mean?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: They lay their eggs inside the unripe beet root, then come spring time the babies eat their way out.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Crazy. That's too much for me man, I'm gonna hit the bathroom.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You've already been several times.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Maybe you have some kinda bladder infection.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I don't know, maybe.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'll order you some cranberry juice.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: With vodka, you're the best.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [to troy] Do you have powers?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [on phone] Oh thank you Hank. You are a lifesaver, Hank. Appreciate it. [to office co-workers] Alright, so Hank is gonna come down here and he's gonna let us all out. [lowers voice] He said it should just be under an hour, so... [everyone groans] we did it.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: We should all make sure to give him a big tip this Christmas.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Sorry guys, but I don't think I tipped him for last year's.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Yeah, neither did I.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Jim was supposed to collect it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yup...

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Way to go, man.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Now he's never gonna come.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: By a show of hands, who thinks we're a better couple than Jim and Pam? [people raise hands]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Phyllis.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I umm, thought about getting a tattoo on my back as well at one point. I was thinking about getting "Back to the Future."  "Back" because it's on my back and "Future" because I'm the kind of guy who likes to look ahead into the future. I just think a tattoo should mean something, you know? And it's my second favorite movie.

quotes.speaker: Girl in Club
quotes.text: I've never heard of that movie.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Back to the Future? [she shakes head] Oh, wow. Well you should take a, a film education course.

quotes.speaker: Girl in Club
quotes.text: How old are you?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Forty... I'm in my forties.

quotes.speaker: Girl in Club
quotes.text: Wow. That's so cool.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nuhh...

quotes.speaker: Girl in Club
quotes.text: Well I'm gonna go back to my group now.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, OK.

quotes.speaker: Girl in Club
quotes.text: Thanks for the drink.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You are welcome.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: This place is like sexy pre-school.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Did you want a place where we could meet older women?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I would love a place where we could meet older girls.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Hell yeah. I'll hook it up. [smashes beer bottle on the floor]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ahh, wow. That's dangerous.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [to bouncer] Check again, Ryan Howard.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [to tall woman in front of him, tapping her shoulder] Excuse me.

quotes.speaker: Tall Girl #1
quotes.text: Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [referring to girls in front of him] How did you all find each other?

quotes.speaker: Tall Girl #1
quotes.text: Uh, we're the Jersey State Varsity Basketball team. Northeast Regional Champs.

quotes.speaker: All Girls
quotes.text: Wooo!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Amazons.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [to Dwight, Michael and Troy] It's off. It's not the dude I know. It's some other loser who won't let us in without chicks.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You're kidding.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Let's bail. [starts to leave]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ok, wai, wai, wai, wait, wait. [turns Ryan around annd points to basketball players] You two, Jersey State girls, let's go.

quotes.speaker: Tall Girl #2
quotes.text: We're not going unless we can all go.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: OK. You know what, fine. Let's go, two girls to a guy. Come on, let's do it. C'mon, Ryan. Move out. OK, three or four with him [referring to Troy]. Let's go, c'mon. Here we go.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Hey, look what I found in the back. [shows a football to Pam] Wanna play? Teach you to throw.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I know how to throw a football.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Course you do.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah, Pam! Hit me up! Go long. Woo! [Pam throws football, hits Meredith's face]

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Owww!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Oh God.

quotes.speaker: Bartender
quotes.text: There you go.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Wait, wait a minute, what's this, I didn't order this?

quotes.speaker: Bartender
quotes.text: It's for you. From them. [points to Jersey State girls across the bar]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh. [dumps drink out]

quotes.speaker: Troy
quotes.text: What are you doing man?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It's not safe. Anything could have been in there. [to girls] Nice try.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I've never met anyone who does that. You wash dogs? Very cool.

quotes.speaker: Girl in 2nd Club
quotes.text: That's one aspect of small pet grooming. What do you do?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I am a bank teller.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ryan told me to always tell women you work in finance.

quotes.speaker: Girl in 2nd Club
quotes.text: Cool.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I think so.

quotes.speaker: Girl in 2nd Club
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, I have fun.

quotes.speaker: Girl in 2nd Club
quotes.text: I'm just gonna just use the powder room.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right.

quotes.speaker: Girl in 2nd Club
quotes.text: So I'll see ya soon.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Very perfect. [girl walks away, Michael laughs] Oh my [notices Dwight making out with Tall Girl #1] This needs to be shared. [takes a picture with his camera phone] [Cut to the office - All Office co-workers cell phones go off. They notice the picture Michael has sent and all groan]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: She washes dogs.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: You're doing it man.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I know. I don't wanna get ahead of myself, but I think I want her to meet my mom.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Hey man, you ever think there's gonna be this massive nuclear holocaust, and after all the major nations are destroyed they'll just be the tribes in the jungle that rise up and survive? The jungle war fare's gonna rule the world?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, maybe. [notices previous girl talking to another guy]

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: It's inevitable, right?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hmm...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [on phone] Please don't pick up, please don't pick up, please don't pick up.

quotes.speaker: Hank
quotes.text: Hello?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Haaank. Is that you?

quotes.speaker: Hank
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Still haven't left the house yet, huh?

quotes.speaker: Hank
quotes.text: I'll get ready to leave.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Good. Please hurry.

quotes.speaker: Hank
quotes.text: [on phone] Stop calling me so I can put on my damn socks!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Will do. [hangs up] I'll stop calling.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [on phonne] I am. I am getting out there. Well, no I've asked a lot of girls to dance mom. They're just, it's not... [Ryan is dancing feverishly and falls over] Yes, I shaved above my neck. Oh my God, mom, I gotta go. One of my friends is getting beaten up by some girls.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Actually, it's kind of too bad we're not coming into work tomorrow.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Why?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I bet Michael had some elaborate theme party planned, like Scrambled Egg Saturday. [a few chuckles]

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: More like "Everyone let's get your boss laid Saturday." [more laughs] [Toby puts his hand on Pam's knee, everyone stares, Toby removes his hand] I have an announcement uh, to make. I am moving to Costa Rica. Thought about it for a long time now. And I'm finally gonna do it. So, I'm just gonna hop the fence and jog home now. [runs out of lobby and climbs the fence and jogs away]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Michael and Troy dragging Ryan out of the club] Those girls really wailed on you bad.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Why wouldn't they let me dance?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well...

quotes.speaker: Troy
quotes.text: OK I gotta go. Do not take him to a hospital. [runs away]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pretty weird. [Dwight and tall girl run out of club]

quotes.speaker: Tall Girl #1
quotes.text: [to Dwight] You have to go with me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I do, I have to go.

quotes.speaker: Tall Girl #1
quotes.text: Stay. Stay, please?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, I have to go. Good luck against Conn College, alright?

quotes.speaker: Tall Girl #1
quotes.text: Call me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Uh huh. [to Ryan and Michael] I'm not gonna call her.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Let's go.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I don't wanna go back in.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I know, here we go.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [notices cleaning crew coming up to the gate] Cleaning people. Oscar. [everyone starts to walk outside] OK, so all you need to do is explain to them what happened, 'cause I think they can help us.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Why are you assuming they only speak Spanish?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I... just... if they speak Spanish.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: [to cleaning people] Good evening, we locked ourselves in. [women don't respond] Nosotros trabajamos aqui, nos trancamos, OK?

quotes.speaker: Cleaning Lady
quotes.text: Ohh...

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: They happened to speak Spanish.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Lucky us.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: This is a one time thing, you know that right? [they walk into Ryan's apartment]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Wow.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: This is it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: All right.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: This is where the magic happens.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Nice.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Very nice.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: One of you guys can have the sofa, and one of you guys can have...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I got sofa. I got sofa.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight, I'm the boss.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I got floor.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Case anyone needs to go to the bathroom in the middle of the night, I don't wannna get my head stepped on.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [to Ryan] Do you want me to sing you a song my mother used to sing me, when we were sick?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: No. [Dwight starts singing in German]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight, shh shh. Dwight. Leave him alone.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It's a lullaby.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Shh. Ryan, Ryan, we're going to take your clothes off.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: No. Guys, I think my friend Troy might have a drug problem. What do I do?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I think his species might have a higher tolerance than ours.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Shh, just stop. Here's what you do. You tell him that you're his friend and that you're gonna help him and that everyone's gonna be all right. And then you put a wire on him and you find out who's selling him drugs and then you get that guy and you flip up, turn him into a snitch. You follow that guy to the people who's really really bad. Been watching The Wire recently. I don't understand a word of it.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Guys, I'm going to sleep. You can leave the light on if you want, but please stop talking, OK?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: OK. Good night Ryan.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Best night ever.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Like I said, it's not about the horniness, it's about the loneliness. And how can I be lonely with my boys? Like a famous person once said, Boys on the side. But I don't, I disagree, I say... let's hear it for the boys.

quotes.speaker: Hank
quotes.text: [drives up to parking lot to notice all the office cars are gone] Son of a bitch.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You're gonna be okay, it's gonna...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ohhh, man!  [sound of Ryan throwing up] There it goes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ahh, ooh!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I am so sorry.  I'm so sorry, sir.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [helping Ryan out of the taxi] Come on, come on.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That'll come out of the upholstery. Oh, man.  He threw up in the back of the taxi.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Dehydration.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Here we go, let's sit down.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It's dehydration.  He went to the bathroom at the club like fifteen times.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right, shhh.  Dwight, leave him alone.

quotes.speaker: Troy
quotes.text: Hey, don't blame me for what Ryan does.  I'm not his dad.  I'm his friend, okay?  And friends are there to help you have a good time.  And sell you the stuff you need to have a good time.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You had a rough night tonight.  But your life is very good, my friend.  You've got a great job, you... you can have any woman you want, you're good looking, you, you know...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Friends with a hobbit.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Frien..sss...yes, you're friends with a hobbit, and... look where you live.  I mean, you've got it all.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yeah, New York is great.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, I mean this apartment building, it's fantastic.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Oh, this, this is not my apartment.  This, this is the Metropolitan Museum of Art.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, now I can say that I went to a museum.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: [Phyllis, Pam, Toby, and Oscar are sharing iPod headphones] I don't understand.  Which one is that?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That's the other Boleyn girl.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Honestly, the book is so much better than this.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Shh.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: [through the fence to Terri, who's holding a drink for him to sip] Ah, we don't know.  They didn't give him his Christmas bonus this year, so...

quotes.speaker: Hank
quotes.text: [on phone]  Stop calling me so I can put on my damn socks!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Will do. [hangs up]  I'll stop calling.  [walks into lobby]

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Was he still there?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, that was his wife, so he's on his way.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Jim, how long?  I have to go to the bathroom.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, he'll be here really soon, Kev.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: If you hadn't made us stay, we'd all be home by now.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Somebody's always got to be a hero.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I'm so cold, I'm gonna faint.  If I faint, it's totally your fault, Jim.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Let's be honest, it's not totally my fault. [indicates Pam]  Shared responsibility.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Mmm?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, I just mean if you, if you didn't lock the door, then we could be upstairs where it's warmer.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'm supposed to turn the lock when I leave, it's part of my job.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Is that... I didn't know that was your... okay, so we're in agreement, this is not ideal... situation.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ryan?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Do you ever miss us?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Not really.  New York is...so great.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ryan?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Do you remember what color my eyes are?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hazel.  They're hazel.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight, I asked him.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: No, I, I was going to say hazel, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Not just because he said it?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ryan?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: You're my friend, Michael.  OK?
